fn_name.description: Name of the rule from PRP
fn_name.title: Fn Name

fn_result.description: Result of the results of the rule from PRP
fn_result.title: Fn Result

fn_note.description: Description of risky acitivity associated with the rule trigger from PRP
fn_note.title: Fn Note

freeze.description: Whether the fraud rule that was triggered contains a freeze flag. Returns `true` if the freeze flag is triggered.
freeze.title: Freeze

subtenant_data.description:
Consists of multiple components provide details on PRP's performance and your fraud policy:
* `features`— contains data for specific features you choose to return as a record of specific transaction metrics that are utilized in your fraud rule policy and to measure your cardholder behavior. For each feature returned you will receive the `feature_name`, `feature_value`, and data type.
* `rule_execution`— contains all rules triggered within your fraud policy and the associated data that is confirgued in PRP for that rule. Includes `rule_id`, `rule_score`, `rule_name`, rule action, and supplementary actions. If you configure an action to update a data source or to take an action, the associated data is specific to that rule.
* `supplementary_action`— contains data on actions and next steps that PRP takes based on your fraud policy configuration. If you configure an action to update a data source or to take an action, the associated data is in this object in a consolidated view.
subtenant_data.title: Subtenant Data

event_id.description: Unique identifier of the transaction event
event_id.title: Event Id

galileo_data.description: A structure that contains transaction information from PRP

reject.description: Whether a transaction is recommended to be rejected by PRP. Returns `true` if rejected.
reject.title: Reject

freeze.description: Whether the account was frozen. Returns `true` if frozen.
freeze.title: Freeze

notes.description: Notes provided associated with the fraud rules of a transaction event
notes.title: Notes

rules_denied.description: Specifies fraud rules concerning the transaction event that triggered a denied message
rules_denied.title: Rules Denied

rules_warned.description: Specifies fraud rules concerning the transaction event that triggered a denied message
rules_warned.title: Rules Warned

fn_name.description: Name of the rule from PRP
fn_name.title: Fn Name

fn_result.description: Result of the results of the rule from PRP
fn_result.title: Fn Result

fn_note.description: Description of risky acitivity associated with the rule trigger from PRP
fn_note.title: Fn Note

freeze.description: Whether the fraud rule that was triggered contains a freeze flag. Returns `true` if the freeze flag is triggered.
freeze.title: Freeze

galileo_data.title: SuccessFraudDetectionMessage

transaction_id.description: An ID that represents an API transaction
transaction_id.title: Transaction Id

provider_timestamp.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes
provider_timestamp.title: Provider Timestamp

provider_transaction_id.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)
provider_transaction_id.title: Provider Transaction Id

person_uuid.description: Galileo-generated UUID of the account holder associated with the transaction event
person_uuid.title: Person Uuid

* `rule_execution`— contains all rules triggered within your fraud policy and the associated data that is confirgued in PRP for that rule. Includes `rule_id`, `rule_score`, `rule_name`, rule action, and supplementary actions. If you configure an action to update a data source or to take an action, the associated data is specific to that rule.
* `supplementary_action`— contains data on actions and next steps that PRP takes based on your fraud policy configuration. If you configure an action to update a data source or to take an action, the associated data is in this object in a consolidated view.

transaction_id.description: An ID that you provide that is unique to each API request. A UUID is preferred
transaction_id.title: Transaction Id

event_ts.description: Date time for when the event occurred

account_id.description: An ID of your customer account for which the related event is associated with

person_id.description: An ID of your customer for which the related event is associated with

status_code.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.
status_code.title: Status Code

status.description: The condition of a process or response
status.title: Status

errors.description: A list of errors generated while the request was processed
errors.title: Errors

rtoken.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking
rtoken.title: Rtoken

processing_time.description: The time elapsed in processing the request
processing_time.title: Processing Time

* `rule_execution`— contains all rules triggered within your fraud policy and the associated data that is confirgued in PRP for that rule. Includes `rule_id`, `rule_score`, `rule_name`, rule action, and supplementary actions. If you configure an action to update a data source or to take an action, the associated data is specific to that rule.
* `supplementary_action`— contains data on actions and next steps that PRP takes based on your fraud policy configuration. If you configure an action to update a data source or to take an action, the associated data is in this object in a consolidated view.

post.description:
Use the Get Card Transaction Fraud API to understand if a transaction is fraudulent.


Consult the _About the Payment Risk Platform_ guide for details.

schema.description:
apiLogin, apiTransKey, and providerId are mentioned here mainly to
be added to the docs. The doc team has a script which marks these as required

apiLogin.description:
Web service username, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"AbC123-9999"`
apiLogin.title: Apilogin

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`
apiTransKey.title: Apitranskey

providerId.description:
Galileo-issued provider identifier.
Pattern: Max 10 digits
Example: `"9999"`
providerId.title: Providerid

transactionId.description:
A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`
transactionId.title: Transactionid

riskServiceId.description:
Unique identifier provided by Galileo during implementation to obtain client PRP configuration details.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"EPRP-test-1231231:1"`
riskServiceId.title: Riskserviceid

eventType.description:
Specifies the type of the transaction event.
Pattern: Debit
Example: `"Debit"`
eventType.title: EventType

eventTs.description: Timestamp for when the transaction event occurred, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700). See Galileo System Time guide for details. May be the same timestamp as `authTs`. Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss Example: `"2020-10-28 00:00:24"`
eventTs.title: Eventts

personId.description:
Unique identifier of the account holder/customer associated with the event.
Pattern: Max 20 characters
Example: `"p54789641"`
personId.title: Personid

accountId.description:
Unique identifier of your customer account for which the related event is associated with.
Pattern: Max 20 characters
Example: `"a125483"`
accountId.title: Accountid

cardId.description:
An identifier of the card for which the related event is associated with.
Pattern: Max 20 characters
Example: `"card_123"`
cardId.title: Cardid

authId.description:
Internal card authorization identifier associated with card transaction event.
Pattern: Max 4 characters
Example: `"8989"`
authId.title: Authid

authTs.description:
Authorization timestamp. Can specify any timezone.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
Example: `"2024-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00"`
authTs.title: Authts

acctOpenToBuy.description:
The cardholder's available funds, also known as open to buy. Amount is checked during authorization validation to confirm the cardholder has sufficient funds to perform a transaction.
Pattern: Integer or decimal amount
Example: `'200.00'`
acctOpenToBuy.title: Acctopentobuy

acctCity.description:
Cardholder’s city.
Pattern: Max 30 characters: letters, spaces, hyphen and period
Example: `"Salt Lake City"`
acctCity.title: Acctcity

acctState.description:
Cardholder’s state or province for non US countries.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"Washington"`
acctState.title: Acctstate

acctZip.description:
Cardholder’s postal code (e.g. US ZIP code or local postal code).
Pattern: Min 5 characters and max 20 characters
Example: `"98101"`
acctZip.title: Acctzip

acctCountry.description:
Cardholder’s two-digit country code. See the IBAN Alpha-2 codes for details.
Pattern: Max 2 characters
Example: `"US"`
acctCountry.title: Acctcountry

acctStartDate.description:
Start date-time for the account was marked ready to use (e.g. account open or account funded date).
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
Example: `"2020-10-12T10:45:21.000+00:00"`
acctStartDate.title: Acctstartdate

cardActivateDate.description:
Date-time for when the card was activated.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
Example: `"2020-10-10T08:12:35.000+00:00"`
cardActivateDate.title: Cardactivatedate

cardStatus.description:
Status for the card.
Pattern: Max 10 character
Example: `"Active"`
cardStatus.title: Cardstatus

cardCredLim.description:
Credit limit of the cardholder’s account as whole or decimal amount.
Pattern:  Integer or decimal number
Example: `'1000'`
cardCredLim.title: Cardcredlim

merchantAssertsAuthenticationAttempted.description:
Specifies whether the merchant/acquirer attempted to authenticate the buyer using 3-D Secure. `True` if attempted, `False` if the merchant/acquirer did not attempt.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
merchantAssertsAuthenticationAttempted.title: Merchantassertsauthenticationattempted

transactionCity.description:
Merchant's city.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `Seattle`
transactionCity.title: Transactioncity

transactionZip.description:
Postal code (US zip code or local postal code) where the transaction or event was performed.
Pattern: Min 5 characters and max 20 characters
Example: `"98102"`
transactionZip.title: Transactionzip

isCardNotPresent.description:
Whether a card was present during a transaction or event. `True` is card-not-present; `False` is card-present.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isCardNotPresent.title: Iscardnotpresent

isCardholderNotPresent.description:
Whether a card was present during a transaction or event. `True` is card-not-present; `False` is card-present.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isCardholderNotPresent.title: Iscardholdernotpresent

isDomestic.description:
Whether this is a domestic transaction. `True` is a domestic transaction; `False` for an international transaction. Definition of domestic at the discretion of the client.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isDomestic.title: Isdomestic

merchantDesc.description:
Card acceptor name/location. See Data element 43 of the ISO message.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"ROSS"`
merchantDesc.title: Merchantdesc

merchantId.description:
Card acceptor identification code. See Data element 42 of the ISO message.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"Ross_1234"`
merchantId.title: Merchantid

networkName.description:
The card network. Acceptable values are: Visa, Mastercard, Discover, American Express, JCB, UnionPay, Accel, Star, Allpoint.
Pattern: Max 20 characters
Example: `"Visa"`
networkName.title: Networkname

requestedAmount.description:
The requested amount.
Pattern: Integer or decimal amount
Example: `'85'`
requestedAmount.title: Requestedamount

isContactless.description:
Whether this is a transaction is contactless. `True` is a contactless transaction. Definition of contactless is at the discretion of the client.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isContactless.title: Iscontactless

isMagStripeRead.description:
Whether the card’s magnetic stripe was swiped. `True` is yes.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isMagStripeRead.title: Ismagstriperead

isRecurring.description:
Whether the transaction is a recurring bill payment.`True` is for a recurring bill payment.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isRecurring.title: Isrecurring

isTransactionEmv.description:
Whether the transaction used an EMV chip.`True` for when an EMV chip was used.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isTransactionEmv.title: Istransactionemv

threedsecureIndicator.description:
Whether the transaction is 3-D Secure. `True` if the transaction was authenticated using 3-D Secure.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
threedsecureIndicator.title: Threedsecureindicator

acquirerInstitutionIdCode.description:
Acquiring institution identification code. See Data element 32 of the ISO message.
Pattern: Max 6 characters
Example: `"INST_12"`
acquirerInstitutionIdCode.title: Acquirerinstitutionidcode

mcc.description:
Merchant category code, also known as the MCC. This indicates the type of merchant at the point of sale, such as supermarket, auto supply, etc. Codes are defined in the ISO 18245. See Data element 18 of the ISO message.
Pattern: Max 4 characters
Example: `"6011"`
mcc.title: Mcc

messageTypeIndicator.description:
Message type indicator for the authorization message being sent by the card network.See Data element 22 of the ISO message.
Pattern: Max 4 characters
Example: `"0180"`
messageTypeIndicator.title: Messagetypeindicator

posEntryModeFull.description:
Point of service (POS) entry mode code. See Data element 22 of the ISO message.
Pattern:  Max 2 characters
Example: `"05"`
posEntryModeFull.title: Posentrymodefull

transTypeCode.description:
Cardholder transaction type code. See Data element 3 subfield 1 of the ISO message.
Pattern: Max 2 characters
Example: `"01"`
transTypeCode.title: Transtypecode

aav.description:
Result from validating the 3-D Secure Accountholder authentication value. Accepted values: 'Y'- Validated, 'F' - Failed, 'N' - Not present.
Pattern: Max 1 character
Example: `"Y"`
aav.title: Aav

avs.description:
Result from validating the 3-D Secure Accountholder authentication value. Accepted values: 'Y'- Validated, 'F' - Failed, 'N' - Not present.
Pattern: Max 1 character
Example: `"Y"`
avs.title: Avs

pin.description:
Indicates the status of the pin. Accepted values: 'Y' - Validated, 'F' - Failed, 'N' - Not present, 'L' - Locked, 'M' - PIN not set, 'B' - Blocked).
Pattern: Max 1 character
Example: `"N"`
pin.title: Pin

riskCode.description:
Risk code sent by card network.
Pattern: Max 3 characters
Example: `"675"`
riskCode.title: Riskcode

transactionCountry.description:
Two character identifier for the country where the transaction was performed.
Pattern: Max 2 characters
Example: `"US"`
transactionCountry.title: Transactioncountry

transactionState.description:
State where the transaction was performed.
Pattern: Max 20 characters
Example: `"Washington"`
transactionState.title: Transactionstate

transactionStateFull.description:
Full province name where transaction occurred. This is only for international transactions. Leave empty for US based transactions.
Pattern: Max 20 characters
Example: `"Ontario"`
transactionStateFull.title: Transactionstatefull

riskScore.description:
Visa Advanced Authorization (VAA) risk score ranging from 0 to 99 or Mastercard Decision Intelligence (DI) score ranging from 0 to 999.
Pattern: Max 4 digits
Example: `56`
riskScore.title: Riskscore

acctStatus.description:
Status of the account.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"Active"`
acctStatus.title: Acctstatus

acctActive.description:
Whether the account is active. `True` for when the account is active.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
acctActive.title: Acctactive

cardholderAppDate.description:
Date-time the cardholder applied for an account.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
Example: `"2020-10-10T08:12:35.000+00:00"`
cardholderAppDate.title: Cardholderappdate

pinFailDate.description:
Date of last PIN failure.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
Example: `"2023-05-10T02:48:38.000+00:00"`
pinFailDate.title: Pinfaildate

isEcommerce.description:
Whether this was an ecommerce transaction. `True` is for ecommerce transactions.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isEcommerce.title: Isecommerce

isMerchantAuthAssertionsValidated.description:
Whether the AAV card value was validated and passed validation. `True` when the AVV card is validated and passed.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isMerchantAuthAssertionsValidated.title: Ismerchantauthassertionsvalidated

aavIndicator.description:
Indicates whether the AAV was authenticated or if an authentication attempt was made.
Pattern: 'Y'
Example: `'Y'`
aavIndicator.title: Aavindicator

rawEci.description:
The ECI sent in the transaction message. This is specific to the card network. Possible values include: `05` (Visa), `212` (MasterCard), `5` (Discover), etc. See Data element 48 Sub Element 42.
Pattern: Max 3 characters
Example: `"05"`
rawEci.title: Raweci

merchantAssertsDataProtection.description:
`True` if the merchant/acquirer asserts that the communication channel between the buyer and the merchant is encrypted (e.g. with TLS/HTTPS). `False` if the merchant/acquirer makes no guarantee about the security of the communication channel with the buyer (e.g. uses HTTP). Proceed with caution when this field is `False`. A malicious third party could have compromised the transaction.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
merchantAssertsDataProtection.title: Merchantassertsdataprotection

merchantAssertsAuthenticated.description:
Whether the merchant authenticated the buyer with 3-D Secure. `True` if the  merchant/acquirer asserts that it authenticated the buyer using 3-D Secure and obtained a valid CAVV/AAV from the card network or Galileo. `False` if the merchant/acquirer makes no assertion whether the buyer is fully authenticated using 3-D Secure.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
merchantAssertsAuthenticated.title: Merchantassertsauthenticated

emvCvn.description:
Cryptogram version number for the EMV transaction.
Pattern: Max 2 characters
Example: `"20"`
emvCvn.title: Emvcvn

emvCvr.description:
Card verification results for the EMV transaction.
Pattern: Max 12 characters
Example: `"a00120400400"`
emvCvr.title: Emvcvr

emvDki.description:
Derivative Key Index (DKI) for the EMV transaction. See Data element 55 for 9F10 value.
Pattern: Max 3 characters
Example: `64`
emvDki.title: Emvdki

provisioningDeviceType.description:
_Visa only_. Type of device used at the provisioning time from ISO8583. See Data element 125.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"dtype_123"`
provisioningDeviceType.title: Provisioningdevicetype

provisioningDeviceLanguage.description: Three letter code for `device_language` at the provisioning time. See ISO 639.2 standards. Pattern: Max 3 characters Example: `"eng"`
provisioningDeviceLanguage.title: Provisioningdevicelanguage

provisioningDeviceId.description:
Device ID at the time of provisioning.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"108998A103804F45740927FF9984ML91J43R"`
provisioningDeviceId.title: Provisioningdeviceid

provisioningDeviceNumber.description:
Device phone number at the provisioning time when applicable. See Data element 125 for Visa or DE 124 for Mastercard.
Pattern: Max 12 characters
Example: `"+18888888888"`
provisioningDeviceNumber.title: Provisioningdevicenumber

provisioningLocation.description:
Latitude and longitude with 2 digits of precision.
Pattern: Max 20 characters
Example: `"+37.78/-122.43"`
provisioningLocation.title: Provisioninglocation

provisioningDeviceIp.description:
IP address of the device at the provisioning time.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"12.45.65.123"`
provisioningDeviceIp.title: Provisioningdeviceip

provisioningDeviceScore.description:
Wallet device score at the provisioning time. See Data element 125 for Visa or DE 124 for Mastercard.
Pattern: Max 2 characters
Example: `"78"`
provisioningDeviceScore.title: Provisioningdevicescore

provisioningAccountScore.description:
Account score at the provisioning time. See Data element 125 for Visa or DE 124 for Mastercard.
Pattern: Max 2 characters
Example: `"5"`
provisioningAccountScore.title: Provisioningaccountscore

provisioningPanSource.description:
Identifies the method which the cardholder is attempting to tokenize a primary account number. See Data element 125 for Visa or DE 124 for Mastercard.
Pattern: Max 2 characters
Example: `"02"`
provisioningPanSource.title: Provisioningpansource

provisioningAccountEmailAddr.description:
Account email address at the time of provisioning.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"someemail@gmail.com"`
provisioningAccountEmailAddr.title: Provisioningaccountemailaddr

provisioningCorrelationId.description:
`correlation_id` at the time of provisioning.
Pattern: Max 20 characters
Example: `"D0000000000000"`
provisioningCorrelationId.title: Provisioningcorrelationid

provisioningPaymentAppInstanceId.description:
`payment_app_instance_id` at the time of provisioning.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"98HAKDSFNQ84R8109R412IU3NRKABSF230"`
provisioningPaymentAppInstanceId.title: Provisioningpaymentappinstanceid

provisioningCardholderName.description:
Cardholder name at the time of provisioning.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"Sam Smith"`
provisioningCardholderName.title: Provisioningcardholdername

provisioningTokenizationRecommendation.description:
Tokenization decision suggested by the wallet provider. See Data element 125 for Visa or DE 124 for Mastercard.
Pattern: Max 1 characters
Example: `"2"`
provisioningTokenizationRecommendation.title: Provisioningtokenizationrecommendation

provisioningTokenizationRecommendationSt.description:
The version of the standards the wallet provider is using to determine the suggested tokenization recommendation. See Data element 125 for Visa or DE 124 for Mastercard.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"tokenstdvar_345"`
provisioningTokenizationRecommendationSt.title: Provisioningtokenizationrecommendationstandardver

provisioningTokenizationRecommendationRe.description:
Indicates the specific reason the wallet provider is suggesting the tokenization recommendation. See Data element 125 for Visa or DE 124 for Mastercard.
Pattern: Max 20 characters
Example: `"00088C"`
provisioningTokenizationRecommendationRe.title: Provisioningtokenizationrecommendationreasoncode

provisioningActiveTokens.description:
`active_tokens` at the time of provisioning.
Pattern: Max 2 characters
Example: `22`
provisioningActiveTokens.title: Provisioningactivetokens

provisioningTokenType.description:
_Mastercard only_. Contains a value indicating the type of requested token. See DE 124 for Mastercard.
Pattern: Max 1 character
Example: `"C"`
provisioningTokenType.title: Provisioningtokentype

provisioningConsumerIdentifier.description:
`consumer_identifier` at the time of provisioning.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"cid_777"`
provisioningConsumerIdentifier.title: Provisioningconsumeridentifier

isPartialAuthSupported.description:
Whether the account supports partial authorizations. `True` for an account that supports partial authorization.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isPartialAuthSupported.title: Ispartialauthsupported

isCardEmv.description:
Whether the card is EMV capable. `True` if card is EMV enabled.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isCardEmv.title: Iscardemv

isEmvFallback.description:
Whether the transaction is when a card product is EMV and the terminal where the transaction is performed is EMV enabled but the transaction is non-EMV.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isEmvFallback.title: Isemvfallback

isFinalCompletion.description:
Whether it is the last preauthorization after multiple preauths that are tied together have been performed and acts as a complete advice/authorization.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isFinalCompletion.title: Isfinalcompletion

isIncrementalAuth.description:
Whether it is part of an incremental authorization tied to other purchases that will settle at the same time (e.g. multiple purchases from a mini-fridge in a hotel).
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isIncrementalAuth.title: Isincrementalauth

isTerminalEmv.description:
Whether the terminal is EMV capable. `True` when EMV is enabled.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isTerminalEmv.title: Isterminalemv

avsRequested.description:
Whether AVS was requested. `True` when requested.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
avsRequested.title: Avsrequested

currencyCodeBilling.description:
Currency Code, Cardholder billing. See Data element 51 of the ISO message.
Pattern: Max 3 characters
Example: `"371"`
currencyCodeBilling.title: Currencycodebilling

currencyCodeTransaction.description:
Currency Code, Transaction. See Data element 49 of the ISO message.
Pattern: Max 3 characters
Example: `"304"`
currencyCodeTransaction.title: Currencycodetransaction

merchantTerminalId.description:
Card Acceptor Terminal Identification Code. See Data element 41 of the ISO message.
Pattern: Max 8 characters
Example: `"05940594"`
merchantTerminalId.title: Merchantterminalid

posConditionCode.description:
_Visa only_. SMS POS Condition. See Data element 25 of the ISO message.
Pattern: Max 2 characters
Example: `"89"`
posConditionCode.title: Posconditioncode

posData.description:
_Mastercard only_. POS Data. See Data element 61 of the ISO message.
Pattern: Max 30 characters
Example: `00000000030000040000012039410324`
posData.title: Posdata

isHighRisk.description:
Flag to indicate whether card is high risk.
Pattern: `True` or `False`
Example: ``True``
isHighRisk.title: Ishighrisk

arqc.description:
A cryptogram that is generated by the chip on a card during a chip transaction and sent to Galileo to validate that the source of the transaction is legitimate.
Pattern: Max 1 characters
Example: `N`
arqc.title: Arqc

cvv1Status.description:
Indicates status of CVV1. Accepted values: 'Y' - Verified, 'N' - Failed, 'None' - No CVV1 Passed.
Pattern: Max 4 characters
Example: `'Y'`
cvv1Status.title: Cvv1Status

cvv2Status.description:
Indicates status of CVV2. Accepted values: 'Y' - Verified, 'N' - Failed, 'None' - No CVV2 Passed.
Pattern: Max 4 characters
Example: `'N'`
cvv2Status.title: Cvv2Status

cvv3Status.description:
Indicates status of CVV3. Accepted values: 'Y' - Verified, 'N' - Failed, 'None' - No CVV3 Passed.
Pattern: Max 4 characters
Example: `'N'`
cvv3Status.title: Cvv3Status

offlinePinStatus.description:
Indicates the status of the offline pin. Accepted values: 'Y' - Verified, 'N' - Failed, 'E' - Offline Pin Try Count Exceeded, 'P' - Failed or tries exceeded, but within risk parameters, 'None' - No Offline PIN verification performed.
Pattern: Max 4 characters
Example: `'N'`
offlinePinStatus.title: Offlinepinstatus

cashbackAmount.description:
Cashback amount that was requested.
Pattern: Max 10 characters
Example: `354`
cashbackAmount.title: Cashbackamount

level1.description:
Hierarchy level 1 of your program.
Pattern: Consumer
Example: `level 1`
level1.title: Level1

level2.description:
Hierarchy level 2 of your program.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `Division - HSA`
level2.title: Level2

level3.description:
Hierarchy level 3 of your program.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `Client`
level3.title: Level3

level4.description:
Hierarchy level 4 of your program.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `Galileo`
level4.title: Level4

level5.description:
Hierarchy level 5 of your program.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `Cohort`
level5.title: Level5

level6.description:
Hierarchy level 6 of your program.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `Group`
level6.title: Level6

level7.description:
Hierarchy level 7 of your program.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `Account ID`
level7.title: Level7

level8.description:
Hierarchy level 8 of your program.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `level 8`
level8.title: Level8

level9.description:
Hierarchy level 9 of your program.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `Card ID`
level9.title: Level9

level10.description:
Hierarchy level 10 of your program.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `Card Type`
level10.title: Level10

customField1.description:
Optional custom field containing additional data elements to send Galileo.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"field1val"`
customField1.title: Customfield1

customField2.description:
Optional custom field containing additional data elements to send Galileo.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"field2val"`
customField2.title: Customfield2

customField3.description:
Optional custom field containing additional data elements to send Galileo.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"field3val"`
customField3.title: Customfield3

customField4.description:
Optional custom field containing additional data elements to send Galileo.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"field4val"`
customField4.title: Customfield4

customField5.description:
Optional custom field containing additional data elements to send Galileo.
Pattern: Max 60 characters
Example: `"field5val"`
customField5.title: Customfield5

echo.title: Echo

post.description: Use the Verify Bank Account API to determine validity of Bank Account.

transactionId.description:
An ID that you provide that is unique to each API request. A UUID is preferred
Pattern: 
Example: `"txn_1234"`
transactionId.title: Transactionid

eventTs.description:
Date time for when the event occurred
Pattern: 
Example: `"2024-01-23T04:56:07.000+00:00"`
eventTs.title: Eventts

accountId.description:
An ID of your customer account for which the related event is associated with
Pattern: 
Example: `"acc_123"`
accountId.title: Accountid

personId.description:
An ID of your customer for which the related event is associated with
Pattern: 
Example: `"per_123"`
personId.title: Personid

firstName.description:
First name of customer.
Pattern: 
Example: `John`
firstName.title: Firstname

middleName.description:
Middle name of customer.
Pattern: 
Example: `John`
middleName.title: Middlename

lastName.description:
Last name of customer.
Pattern: 
Example: `John`
lastName.title: Lastname

acctNo.description:
Account number of bank account.
Pattern: 
Example: `841523654`
acctNo.title: Acctno

rtNo.description:
Routing number of bank account.
Pattern: 
Example: `021000021`
rtNo.title: Rtno

dob.description:
Date of birth of bank account holder. In YYYY-MM-DD format.
Pattern: 
Example: `2024-01-01`
dob.title: Dob

addr1.description:
Address line 1 of bank account holder.
Pattern: 
Example: `1417 n. rue st.`
addr1.title: Addr1

addr2.description:
Address line 2 of bank account holder.
Pattern: 
Example: `APT 5520`
addr2.title: Addr2

city.description:
City of bank account holder.
Pattern: 
Example: `saint charles`
city.title: City

state.description:
State of bank account holder.
Pattern: 
Example: `MO`
state.title: State

zip.description:
Zip of bank account holder. 5 digits
Pattern: 
Example: `63301`
zip.title: Zip

phoneNo.description:
Phone number of bank account holder. In E.164 format.
Pattern: 
Example: `+11234567890`
phoneNo.title: Phoneno

emailAddr.description:
Email address of bank account holder.
Pattern: 
Example: `jdoe@example.com`
emailAddr.title: Emailaddr

ipAddr.description:
IP address of bank account holder.
Pattern: 
Example: `255.10.10.20`
ipAddr.title: Ipaddr

acctType.description:
Account type of bank account.
Pattern: 
Example: `"personal", "business" or "other"`

ctryCd.description:
2-letter country code (ISO 3166-1)  of external bank account holder.
Pattern: 
Example: `US`

idDocNo.description:
SSN or Tax ID of bank account holder ssn or tax id.
Pattern: 
Example: `1234567890`
idDocNo.title: Iddocno

idDocType.description:
ID type of bank account holder.
Pattern: 
Example: `ssn`

acctSubtype.description:
Account subtype of bank account holder.
Pattern: 
Example: `"checking" or "savings"`
